docs.summary: [VideoBox](https://support.wix.com/en/article/videobox) is an element for displaying videos in customizable video containers.
description: A VideoBox is a design element that allows you to showcase your videos in designed, fully-customizable video containers.
A video box also allows you to control how site visitors interact with it.
Unlike the [`VideoPlayer`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/$w/videoplayer) element, a video box does
not expose text descriptions or titles, and cannot be displayed in full-screen mode.
A video box allows you to present video from the following sources:
+ Videos uploaded to your site
+ Transparent videos uploaded to your site
+ Videos and transparent videos from the Wix Media library

docs.summary: Gets the current play time from the beginning of the current video, in seconds.

examples.title: Get the current play time

docs.summary: Gets the total play time of the current video, in seconds.

examples.title: Get the current video's duration

docs.summary: Indicates if the volume is currently muted.
description: To set the `isMuted` property, use the [`mute()`](#mute)
and [`unmute()`](#unmute) functions.

examples.title: Get whether the volume is muted

docs.summary: Indicates if a video is currently playing.
description: To set the `isPlaying` property, use the [`play()`](#play),
[`pause()`](#pause), and [`stop()`](#stop) functions.

examples.title: Get whether a video is playing

docs.summary: Sets or gets the file location of the current video.
description: Setting the `src` property changes the displayed video to
the video found at the new `src` value.
Getting the `src` property returns the location of the
current video file.
The video file is a video from the Media Manager.
URL Format: `wix:video://v1/<video_uri>/<filename>#posterUri=<poster_uri>&posterWidth=<width>&posterHeight=<height>`.
Transparent videos are also supported.

examples.title: Get the current video's location
Set the current video to a video uploaded to your site

docs.summary: Sets or gets the video box volume.
description: Setting the `volume` property sets the video box's percentage of total
volume. Set the value to a number between `0` and `100`.
Getting the `volume` property returns the video box's current
percentage of total volume.

examples.title: Get a video box's volume
Set a video box's volume

notes:
The actual volume heard by a site visitor depends on the value of the
 `volume` property and the volume settings on the visitor's device.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the volume has been muted.

examples.title: Mute volume
Mute volume and log a message when done

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the video has ended.

ret.doc: The video box that triggered the event.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the playback has ended.
description: A video ends when the playback reaches the [`duration`](#duration) of the video.
If the video is set to play in a loop, this event handler is never triggered.

examples.title: Get the ID of the video box whose video has ended

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the pointer is moved onto the
 element.

ret.doc: The element to which the event handler was added.

docs.summary: **Note: This standard element property is not relevant for VideoBox.**
description: Adds an event handler that runs when the pointer is moved
onto the element.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the pointer is moved off of
 the element.

ret.doc: The element to which the event handler was added.

docs.summary: **Note: This standard element property is not relevant for VideoBox.**
description: Adds an event handler that runs when the pointer is moved
off of the element.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the video is paused.

ret.doc: The video box that triggered the event.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the playback is paused.
description: A video in a video box is paused when a site visitor clicks the video box's
pause button or by calling its [`pause()`](#pause) or [`stop()`](#stop) functions.

examples.title: Get the ID of the video box that has been paused

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the video in the video box is played.

ret.doc: The video box that triggered the event.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the playback is started or restarted.
description: A video in a video box is played when a site visitor clicks the video box's
play button or by calling its [`play()`](#play) function.

examples.title: Get the ID of the video box that is playing

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the video progresses.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the playback progresses.
description: A video continually progresses as the video plays.

examples.title: Get the ID of the video box that is progressing

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the playback has been paused.

description: The `pause()` function pauses the current video and fires a `pause` event.
The [onPause( )](#onPause) event handler is called.
Any event handlers [set in the Editor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-about-videoboxes#change-the-behavior-of-your-videobox) are also called.

examples.title: Pause playback
Pause playback and log a message when done

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the playback begins or resumes.

description: The `play()` function plays the current video and fires a `play` event.
The [onPlay( )](#onPlay) event handler is called.
Any event handlers [set in the Editor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-about-videoboxes#change-the-behavior-of-your-videobox) are also called.

examples.title: Begin or resume playback
Begin or resume playback and log a message when done

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the playback has been stopped.

description: The `stop()` function stops the current playback,
moves to the beginning of the video, and fires a `pause` event.
The [onPause( )](#onPause) event handler is called.
Any event handlers [set in the Editor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-about-videoboxes#change-the-behavior-of-your-videobox) are also called.

examples.title: Stop playback
Stop playback and log a message when done

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the playback has been toggled.

description: The `togglePlay()` function either pauses or plays the current video based
on its current state:
+ If the video is paused, it plays and a `play` event is fired. The
`play` event handlers set on the video box by the [onPlay( )](#onPlay)
function are called. (Any event handlers [set in the Editor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-about-videoboxes#change-the-behavior-of-your-videobox) are also called.)
+ If the video is playing, it is paused and a `pause` event is fired. The
`pause` event handlers set on the video box by the [onPause( )](#onPause)
function are called.  (Any event handlers [set in the Editor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-about-videoboxes#change-the-behavior-of-your-videobox) are also called.)

examples.title: Toggle playback
Toggle playback and log a message when done

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the volume has been unmuted.

examples.title: Unmute volume
Unmute volume and log a message when done
